intro: Quercus ucriae, commonly known as the Ucrainian oak, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of Ukraine. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, characterized by its acorn-shaped fruits and lobed leaves. The bark of Quercus ucriae is thick and fissured, providing a protective layer against environmental stressors. This species plays a vital role in its local ecosystem, supporting a variety of wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity. Due to habitat loss and climate change, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
